 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;

    font-weight: bold;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1235222: Security: Autofill prompt can render over browser UI (bypasses of recent reports)

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 2, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Specially-crafted pages can trick the browser into rendering autofill prompts over browser UI, which can be used to spoof parts of the browser UI, cover window controls, or for other malicious purposes.<span class="line"><!---->Specially-crafted pages can trick the browser into rendering autofill prompts over browser UI, which can be used to spoof parts of the browser UI, cover window controls, or for other malicious purposes.<!----></span><br><br>This is a bypass of various fixes made in the following issues intended to prevent autofill prompts from being shown outside of content area:<span class="line"><!---->This is a bypass of various fixes made in the following issues intended to prevent autofill prompts from being shown outside of content area:<!----></span><br>Issue 1108181<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108181" title="Security: bypas of the protection of input field cache"><!---->Issue 1108181<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(bypas[s] of the protection of input field cache)<span class="line"><!---->(bypas[s] of the protection of input field cache)<!----></span><br>Issue 1172533<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1172533" title="Security: Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI"><!---->Issue 1172533<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI)<span class="line"><!---->(Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI)<!----></span><br>Issue 1173297<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1173297" title="Security: Autofill dropdown can be made hidden"><!---->Issue 1173297<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(Autofill dropdown can be made hidden)<span class="line"><!---->(Autofill dropdown can be made hidden)<!----></span><br><br>The observed behavior seems to occur because the autofill prompt is only rendered if there is sufficient space below the input element. However, the autofill prompt is also rendered above the input element if there is insufficient space below the element. My theory is this logic or adjacent logic is incorrectly determining there is sufficient space above the input field in certain conditions, resulting in rendering outside the content area.<span class="line"><!---->The observed behavior seems to occur because the autofill prompt is only rendered if there is sufficient space below the input element. However, the autofill prompt is also rendered above the input element if there is insufficient space below the element. My theory is this logic or adjacent logic is incorrectly determining there is sufficient space above the input field in certain conditions, resulting in rendering outside the content area.<!----></span><br><br>There are two ways to reach these conditions, with differently-crafted pages needed for each way (unclear if this indicates two separate issues resulting in same behavior):<span class="line"><!---->There are two ways to reach these conditions, with differently-crafted pages needed for each way (unclear if this indicates two separate issues resulting in same behavior):<!----></span><br>1. Use an iframe in a regular browser window (see Simple + Complex PoCs)<span class="line"><!---->1. Use an iframe in a regular browser window (see Simple + Complex PoCs)<!----></span><br>2. Use a short window, such as a popup created by a page or a window resized by an extension (See Short Window PoC)<span class="line"><!---->2. Use a short window, such as a popup created by a page or a window resized by an extension (See Short Window PoC)<!----></span><br><br>The PoCs in this report are mostly reimplementations of PoCs from the crbugs above, with varying degrees of additional modifications for improved reliability and realism.<span class="line"><!---->The PoCs in this report are mostly reimplementations of PoCs from the crbugs above, with varying degrees of additional modifications for improved reliability and realism.<!----></span><br><br>The Complex PoC also uses secondary techniques described in <span class="line"><!---->The Complex PoC also uses secondary techniques described in <!----></span>issue 1172533<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1172533" title="Security: Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI"><!---->issue 1172533<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>1. Add arbitrary autofill entries via iframes containing forms.<span class="line"><!---->1. Add arbitrary autofill entries via iframes containing forms.<!----></span><br>2. Persist autofill prompt by adding event listeners for most events and cancelling any received events + changing the input element type from `text` to `button`.<span class="line"><!---->2. Persist autofill prompt by adding event listeners for most events and cancelling any received events + changing the input element type from `text` to `button`.<!----></span><br><br>Code which seems relevant (or is likely adjacent to relevant code):<span class="line"><!---->Code which seems relevant (or is likely adjacent to relevant code):<!----></span><br>CanShowDropdownHere(): <span class="line"><!---->CanShowDropdownHere(): <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=5aea5a9f49fb5593071585d5635171ae9477e7e9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=5aea5a9f49fb5593071585d5635171ae9477e7e9"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=5aea5a9f49fb5593071585d5635171ae9477e7e9<!----></a><br>DoUpdateBoundsAndRedrawPopup(): <span class="line"><!---->DoUpdateBoundsAndRedrawPopup(): <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_native_views.cc;l=1382;drc=acf367004aa6c15006bf09839c82b7ffa9f4fb9b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_native_views.cc;l=1382;drc=acf367004aa6c15006bf09839c82b7ffa9f4fb9b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_native_views.cc;l=1382;drc=acf367004aa6c15006bf09839c82b7ffa9f4fb9b<!----></a><br><br>I may have additional variations and insights in the next day or two.<span class="line"><!---->I may have additional variations and insights in the next day or two.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.107 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 94.0.4593.0 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.107 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 94.0.4593.0 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See attached video with recording of all PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->See attached video with recording of all PoCs.<!----></span><br><br>Prerequisite for the Simple + Short Window PoCs if no names are stored in browser's autofill:<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite for the Simple + Short Window PoCs if no names are stored in browser's autofill:<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/"><!---->https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/<!----></a><br>2. Submit the first form to save a name in the browser's autofill.<span class="line"><!---->2. Submit the first form to save a name in the browser's autofill.<!----></span><br><br>Simple PoC:<span class="line"><!---->Simple PoC:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-simple.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-simple.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-simple.html<!----></a><br>2. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<span class="line"><!---->2. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<!----></span><br><br>Complex PoC:<span class="line"><!---->Complex PoC:<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-complex.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-complex.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-complex.html<!----></a><br>2. Click once anywhere in page.<span class="line"><!---->2. Click once anywhere in page.<!----></span><br>3. (Optional:) Type in page to demonstrate spoof persistence with user interactions.<span class="line"><!---->3. (Optional:) Type in page to demonstrate spoof persistence with user interactions.<!----></span><br><br>Short Window PoC:<span class="line"><!---->Short Window PoC:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-shortwin.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-shortwin.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-shortwin.html<!----></a><br>2. Click button to open short window (popup)<span class="line"><!---->2. Click button to open short window (popup)<!----></span><br>3. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofill prompt is rendered above browser UI, such as the address bar and window controls.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofill prompt is rendered above browser UI, such as the address bar and window controls.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofill prompt is rendered below browser UI, or is not rendered if there is no space to safely show.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofill prompt is rendered below browser UI, or is not rendered if there is no space to safely show.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235222#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mamir@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/3883123817" title="mamir@chromium.org"><!---->mamir@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mamir@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mamir@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235222#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235222#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 5:02 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Here is what's going on.<span class="line"><!---->Here is what's going on.<!----></span><br>When displaying an Autofill dropdown we do two things<span class="line"><!---->When displaying an Autofill dropdown we do two things<!----></span><br>- Decide whether we can show it by checking if there is enough height to display at least one item above or below the element. [1]<span class="line"><!---->- Decide whether we can show it by checking if there is enough height to display at least one item above or below the element. [1]<!----></span><br>- Compute where to display the dropdown [2]. <span class="line"><!---->- Compute where to display the dropdown [2]. <!----></span><br><br>When we decide whether we can display the dropdown we use the content area bounds since we decided to that there should be at least one item within the bounds of the content area.<span class="line"><!---->When we decide whether we can display the dropdown we use the content area bounds since we decided to that there should be at least one item within the bounds of the content area.<!----></span><br>However, when computing the location of the dropdown we use the window bounds.<span class="line"><!---->However, when computing the location of the dropdown we use the window bounds.<!----></span><br><br>Those specific repro cases were carefully design to make sure <span class="line"><!---->Those specific repro cases were carefully design to make sure <!----></span><br>A- There is enough space below the element to display one item, so we pass the check in [1]<span class="line"><!---->A- There is enough space below the element to display one item, so we pass the check in [1]<!----></span><br>B- With respect to the window bounds, the element has more space above it than below it, which directs the code in [2] to display the dropdown above the element and hence in a location where there is no enough height to display one item.<span class="line"><!---->B- With respect to the window bounds, the element has more space above it than below it, which directs the code in [2] to display the dropdown above the element and hence in a location where there is no enough height to display one item.<!----></span><br><br>I can see too solutions:<span class="line"><!---->I can see too solutions:<!----></span><br>Solution 1: Make sure to record the decision from the first check in [1] and pass it over when computing the location in [2] (prototype CL: <span class="line"><!---->Solution 1: Make sure to record the decision from the first check in [1] and pass it over when computing the location in [2] (prototype CL: <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3067347<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3067347"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3067347<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>Solution 2: Use content area bounds when computing the location instead of the window bounds (prototype CL: <span class="line"><!---->Solution 2: Use content area bounds when computing the location instead of the window bounds (prototype CL: <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3067328<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3067328"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3067328<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=47;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=47;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=47;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This guarantees that the autofill<span class="line"><!---->Content area bounds are used instead. This guarantees that the autofill<!----></span><br>popup (or at least its beginning) will be within the content area<span class="line"><!---->popup (or at least its beginning) will be within the content area<!----></span><br>and hence prevents against covering browser native UI.<span class="line"><!---->and hence prevents against covering browser native UI.<!----></span><br><br>More details are in the linked bug.<span class="line"><!---->More details are in the linked bug.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This guarantees that the autofill<span class="line"><!---->Content area bounds are used instead. This guarantees that the autofill<!----></span><br>popup (or at least its beginning) will be within the content area<span class="line"><!---->popup (or at least its beginning) will be within the content area<!----></span><br>and hence prevents against covering browser native UI.<span class="line"><!---->and hence prevents against covering browser native UI.<!----></span><br><br>More details            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              Cancel
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;

    text-decoration: none;

    filter: brightness(95%);

    margin-left: auto;

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;

  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Aug 2, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Specially-crafted pages can trick the browser into rendering autofill prompts over browser UI, which can be used to spoof parts of the browser UI, cover window controls, or for other malicious purposes.<span class="line"><!---->Specially-crafted pages can trick the browser into rendering autofill prompts over browser UI, which can be used to spoof parts of the browser UI, cover window controls, or for other malicious purposes.<!----></span><br><br>This is a bypass of various fixes made in the following issues intended to prevent autofill prompts from being shown outside of content area:<span class="line"><!---->This is a bypass of various fixes made in the following issues intended to prevent autofill prompts from being shown outside of content area:<!----></span><br>Issue 1108181<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1108181" title="Security: bypas of the protection of input field cache"><!---->Issue 1108181<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(bypas[s] of the protection of input field cache)<span class="line"><!---->(bypas[s] of the protection of input field cache)<!----></span><br>Issue 1172533<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1172533" title="Security: Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI"><!---->Issue 1172533<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI)<span class="line"><!---->(Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI)<!----></span><br>Issue 1173297<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1173297" title="Security: Autofill dropdown can be made hidden"><!---->Issue 1173297<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(Autofill dropdown can be made hidden)<span class="line"><!---->(Autofill dropdown can be made hidden)<!----></span><br><br>The observed behavior seems to occur because the autofill prompt is only rendered if there is sufficient space below the input element. However, the autofill prompt is also rendered above the input element if there is insufficient space below the element. My theory is this logic or adjacent logic is incorrectly determining there is sufficient space above the input field in certain conditions, resulting in rendering outside the content area.<span class="line"><!---->The observed behavior seems to occur because the autofill prompt is only rendered if there is sufficient space below the input element. However, the autofill prompt is also rendered above the input element if there is insufficient space below the element. My theory is this logic or adjacent logic is incorrectly determining there is sufficient space above the input field in certain conditions, resulting in rendering outside the content area.<!----></span><br><br>There are two ways to reach these conditions, with differently-crafted pages needed for each way (unclear if this indicates two separate issues resulting in same behavior):<span class="line"><!---->There are two ways to reach these conditions, with differently-crafted pages needed for each way (unclear if this indicates two separate issues resulting in same behavior):<!----></span><br>1. Use an iframe in a regular browser window (see Simple + Complex PoCs)<span class="line"><!---->1. Use an iframe in a regular browser window (see Simple + Complex PoCs)<!----></span><br>2. Use a short window, such as a popup created by a page or a window resized by an extension (See Short Window PoC)<span class="line"><!---->2. Use a short window, such as a popup created by a page or a window resized by an extension (See Short Window PoC)<!----></span><br><br>The PoCs in this report are mostly reimplementations of PoCs from the crbugs above, with varying degrees of additional modifications for improved reliability and realism.<span class="line"><!---->The PoCs in this report are mostly reimplementations of PoCs from the crbugs above, with varying degrees of additional modifications for improved reliability and realism.<!----></span><br><br>The Complex PoC also uses secondary techniques described in <span class="line"><!---->The Complex PoC also uses secondary techniques described in <!----></span>issue 1172533<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1172533" title="Security: Autofill suggestion drop-down can cover browser UI"><!---->issue 1172533<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>1. Add arbitrary autofill entries via iframes containing forms.<span class="line"><!---->1. Add arbitrary autofill entries via iframes containing forms.<!----></span><br>2. Persist autofill prompt by adding event listeners for most events and cancelling any received events + changing the input element type from `text` to `button`.<span class="line"><!---->2. Persist autofill prompt by adding event listeners for most events and cancelling any received events + changing the input element type from `text` to `button`.<!----></span><br><br>Code which seems relevant (or is likely adjacent to relevant code):<span class="line"><!---->Code which seems relevant (or is likely adjacent to relevant code):<!----></span><br>CanShowDropdownHere(): <span class="line"><!---->CanShowDropdownHere(): <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=5aea5a9f49fb5593071585d5635171ae9477e7e9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=5aea5a9f49fb5593071585d5635171ae9477e7e9"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=5aea5a9f49fb5593071585d5635171ae9477e7e9<!----></a><br>DoUpdateBoundsAndRedrawPopup(): <span class="line"><!---->DoUpdateBoundsAndRedrawPopup(): <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_native_views.cc;l=1382;drc=acf367004aa6c15006bf09839c82b7ffa9f4fb9b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_native_views.cc;l=1382;drc=acf367004aa6c15006bf09839c82b7ffa9f4fb9b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_native_views.cc;l=1382;drc=acf367004aa6c15006bf09839c82b7ffa9f4fb9b<!----></a><br><br>I may have additional variations and insights in the next day or two.<span class="line"><!---->I may have additional variations and insights in the next day or two.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.107 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 94.0.4593.0 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.107 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable), 94.0.4593.0 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 2009 (Build 19042.1110)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See attached video with recording of all PoCs.<span class="line"><!---->See attached video with recording of all PoCs.<!----></span><br><br>Prerequisite for the Simple + Short Window PoCs if no names are stored in browser's autofill:<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite for the Simple + Short Window PoCs if no names are stored in browser's autofill:<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/"><!---->https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/<!----></a><br>2. Submit the first form to save a name in the browser's autofill.<span class="line"><!---->2. Submit the first form to save a name in the browser's autofill.<!----></span><br><br>Simple PoC:<span class="line"><!---->Simple PoC:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-simple.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-simple.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-simple.html<!----></a><br>2. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<span class="line"><!---->2. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<!----></span><br><br>Complex PoC:<span class="line"><!---->Complex PoC:<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-complex.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-complex.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-complex.html<!----></a><br>2. Click once anywhere in page.<span class="line"><!---->2. Click once anywhere in page.<!----></span><br>3. (Optional:) Type in page to demonstrate spoof persistence with user interactions.<span class="line"><!---->3. (Optional:) Type in page to demonstrate spoof persistence with user interactions.<!----></span><br><br>Short Window PoC:<span class="line"><!---->Short Window PoC:<!----></span><br>Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<span class="line"><!---->Prerequisite: Have at least one saved name in the browser's autofill.<!----></span><br>1. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to <!----></span>https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-shortwin.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-shortwin.html"><!---->https://alesandroortiz.com/security/chromium/autofill-ui-shortwin.html<!----></a><br>2. Click button to open short window (popup)<span class="line"><!---->2. Click button to open short window (popup)<!----></span><br>3. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<span class="line"><!---->3. Press up or down arrow in keyboard.<!----></span><br><br>For all PoCs:<span class="line"><!---->For all PoCs:<!----></span><br>Observed: Autofill prompt is rendered above browser UI, such as the address bar and window controls.<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Autofill prompt is rendered above browser UI, such as the address bar and window controls.<!----></span><br>Expected: Autofill prompt is rendered below browser UI, or is not rendered if there is no space to safely show.<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Autofill prompt is rendered below browser UI, or is not rendered if there is no space to safely show.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235222#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mamir@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/3883123817" title="mamir@chromium.org"><!---->mamir@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mamir@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mamir@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 5:02 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 5:02 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235222#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 5:02 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235222#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 5:02 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Here is what's going on.<span class="line"><!---->Here is what's going on.<!----></span><br>When displaying an Autofill dropdown we do two things<span class="line"><!---->When displaying an Autofill dropdown we do two things<!----></span><br>- Decide whether we can show it by checking if there is enough height to display at least one item above or below the element. [1]<span class="line"><!---->- Decide whether we can show it by checking if there is enough height to display at least one item above or below the element. [1]<!----></span><br>- Compute where to display the dropdown [2]. <span class="line"><!---->- Compute where to display the dropdown [2]. <!----></span><br><br>When we decide whether we can display the dropdown we use the content area bounds since we decided to that there should be at least one item within the bounds of the content area.<span class="line"><!---->When we decide whether we can display the dropdown we use the content area bounds since we decided to that there should be at least one item within the bounds of the content area.<!----></span><br>However, when computing the location of the dropdown we use the window bounds.<span class="line"><!---->However, when computing the location of the dropdown we use the window bounds.<!----></span><br><br>Those specific repro cases were carefully design to make sure <span class="line"><!---->Those specific repro cases were carefully design to make sure <!----></span><br>A- There is enough space below the element to display one item, so we pass the check in [1]<span class="line"><!---->A- There is enough space below the element to display one item, so we pass the check in [1]<!----></span><br>B- With respect to the window bounds, the element has more space above it than below it, which directs the code in [2] to display the dropdown above the element and hence in a location where there is no enough height to display one item.<span class="line"><!---->B- With respect to the window bounds, the element has more space above it than below it, which directs the code in [2] to display the dropdown above the element and hence in a location where there is no enough height to display one item.<!----></span><br><br>I can see too solutions:<span class="line"><!---->I can see too solutions:<!----></span><br>Solution 1: Make sure to record the decision from the first check in [1] and pass it over when computing the location in [2] (prototype CL: <span class="line"><!---->Solution 1: Make sure to record the decision from the first check in [1] and pass it over when computing the location in [2] (prototype CL: <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3067347<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3067347"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3067347<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>Solution 2: Use content area bounds when computing the location instead of the window bounds (prototype CL: <span class="line"><!---->Solution 2: Use content area bounds when computing the location instead of the window bounds (prototype CL: <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3067328<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3067328"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3067328<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=87;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=47;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=47;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/autofill/autofill_popup_view_utils.cc;l=47;drc=d0b89fe9c3d6ecc1ec4ffaf0baeb6b36c34ba7fd<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
